snippet: A large majority of families making up to $300,000 — as well as hundreds of thousands of families with even greater incomes — would not pay taxes at a higher marginal rate.
abstract: Large majority of families making up to $300,000, as well as hundreds of thousands of families with even greater incomes, will not pay taxes at a higher marginal rate in 2013 despite widespread anxiety over Pres Obama's $250,000 threshold.

byline.original: By CATHERINE RAMPELL and BINYAMIN APPELBAUM

lead_paragraph: A large majority of families making up to $300,000 — as well as hundreds of thousands of families with even greater incomes — would not pay taxes at a higher marginal rate.

headline.seo: Obama’s Tax Plan Would Spare Many Affluent Families
headline.main: In Obama’s Plan to Tax Rich, $250,000 Figure May Mislead
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Tax Plan Still Spares Large Portion of Nation’s Affluent
